intro: Oldenlandia labialis, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Oldenlandia labialis is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants.
